question: User documentation is part of your definition of "Done." However, there aren't enough technical writers for all teams. Your Development Team doesn't have a technical writer. What should you do?

options.A: Wait until you have a technical writer on your Development Team to take care of this
options.B: Your Development Team is still responsible for creating user documentation. In this case, the Development Team members will write it
options.C: Let the user documentation remain undone and accumulate until after the last development Sprint It will then be done by any available technical writers
options.D: Form a separate team of technical writers that will work on an on demand basis for the various Product Owners. Work order will be first in, first out

answers: Your Development Team is still responsible for creating user documentation. In this case, the Development Team members will write it
explanation: Waiting for a Technical writer can not be an option. Also, if we keep the documentation undone it will further delay the process. Only to prepare the documentation we cannot form a new team hence we are left with only one option Your Development Team is still responsible for creating user documentation. In this case, the Development Team members will write it.

question: Which of the following are criteria to order Product Backlog items?

options.C: Value of Product Backlog items
options.D: The availability of the Scrum Master

answers: Dependencies between Product Backlog items and Value of Product Backlog items
explanation: Dependencies to other products and availability of Scrum Master are not criteria to order the items in the product backlog.

question: In order to maximize the value of the product, a Product Owner needs awareness of the following:

options.C: Forecasting & feasibility
options.D: Product vision
options.E: Competitive research

answers: Customer feedback
explanation: Customer feedback is the main criteria for the Product Owner to judge over the product release and features.

question: The "cone of uncertainty" can be used to do what?

options.A: Project what will be completed by a given Sprint
options.B: Illustrate that, as a forecast lengthens, it is increasingly less certain
options.C: Determine the cost of a project before it is begun
options.D: Determine whether to cut quality, similar to the Iron Triangle of project management

answers: Determine the cost of a project before it is begun
explanation: The cone of uncertainty is the unknown parameters of the project and it gets reduced as further we move towards the project end. Hence it is expected that we can use it to estimate the project cost initially.

question: Which three of the following are feedback loops in Scrum?

options.C: Sprint Retrospective
options.D: Sprint Review
options.E: Daily Scrum

answers: Sprint Retrospective and Sprint Review and Daily Scrum
explanation: Release Planning, and Refinement Meeting are not scrum events to get feedback. The remaining 3 are.

question: Which two things should the Development Team do during the first Sprint?

options.A: Develop at least one piece of functionality
options.B: Analyze, design, and describe the complete architecture and infrastructure
options.C: Analyze, describe, and document the requirements for the subsequent Sprints
options.D: Create an Increment of potentially releasable software
options.E: Make up a plan for the rest of the project

answers: Develop at least one piece of functionality and Create an Increment of potentially releasable software
explanation: Develop at least one piece of functionality. Create an Increment of potentially releasable software. are the two things that can be done in the first sprint. For an Agile project, a complete plan is never prepared at a go. Also, analyzing and creating complete architecture for subsequent sprint or for total project is not done in the first sprint.

question: Which does a self-organizing Development Team choose?

options.B: When to release, based on its progress
options.C: How to best accomplish its work
options.D: Sprint length
options.E: Stakeholders for the Sprint Review

answers: How to best accomplish its work
explanation: How to best accomplish its work because they know the best way to do their job.

question: The Scrum Master Observes the Product Owner struggling with ordering the Product Backlog. What is an appropriate action for the Scrum Master to take?

options.A: Present the Product Owner with an ordered Product Backlog to use
options.B: Encourage the Product Owner to work with the Development Team to see which items technically are fastest to implement
options.C: Suggest the Product Owner extend the Sprint, so he can have more time to order the Product Backlog
options.D: Offer the Product Owner help in understanding that the goal of ordering the Product Backlog is to maximize value
options.E: Suggest that the Development Team does the ordering to be sure that it is a feasible ordering of work

answers: Offer the Product Owner help in understanding that the goal of ordering the Product Backlog is to maximize value
explanation:
The Development Team cannot order the product backlog. Also, extending the sprint cannot be an option. Scrum master cannot prepare the entire Product backlog all by himself. And the objective should be to deliver the highest value item not the fastest one.

Hence we are left with only one option. Offer the Product Owner help in understanding that the goal of ordering the Product Backlog is to maximize value.

question: What is a Product Owner’s responsibility that he/she might delegate?

options.B: Representing stakeholders to the Scrum team
options.C: Ordering the Product Backlog
options.D: Writing User Stories

answers: Ordering the Product Backlog
explanation: The development team may need to order the product backlog as they would know the most about technical limitations, risks, or dependencies between Product Backlog Items. As User Stories is a localized practice, Scrum does not govern it or dictate the practice. How the team describes the items is up to them as long as it has enough information to be transparent and understood.

question: A new Product Owner is hired to work on an existing product that is ongoing for five Sprints. He/she is unsure about all of the responsibilities of a Product Owner. Which of these Product Owner's activities are defined in Scrum?

options.A: Ensuring work is completed within scope and time
options.C: Interacting with stakeholders and ensuring that the most valuable functionality is always produced first
options.D: Writing User Stories

answers: Interacting with stakeholders and ensuring that the most valuable functionality is always produced first
explanation: It is only the PO responsibility to talk to stakeholders and ensure that the most valuable items are selected to deliver in sprint.

question: Peter is a new Product Owner on a newly formed Scrum Team. Peter has Projected a product completion date based on an estimated velocity of 21 completed points per Sprint. After the first 3 Sprints, the team has determined that their maximum velocity is 15 point's, and they are unable to create shippable increments at the end of each Sprint. What is the best way to proceed?

options.A: Inform Peter that the projected completion date is not correct. The Development team would estimate the remaining work to produce a shippable Increment and suggest making it ‘Done” before working on new features. Based on empirical data, Peter car’ adjust the completion date and decide how to continue
options.B: The Sprints have failed to produce shippable Increments therefore opportunities to inspect and adapt are lost. The Scrum Master would encourage the organization to add more team members in order to increase the team’s capacity
options.C: The Scrum Master would coach the team on improving their estimations and commitment to completing the Sprint Backlog
options.D: Extend the Sprint in order to complete the Sprint Backlog items

answers: Inform Peter that the projected completion date is not correct. The Development team would estimate the remaining work to produce a shippable Increment and suggest making it ‘Done” before working on new features. Based on empirical data, Peter car’ adjust the completion date and decide how to continue
explanation: Inform Peter that the projected completion date is not correct. The Development team would estimate the remaining work to produce a shippable increment and suggest making it “Done” before working on new features. Based on empirical data, Peter can adjust the completion date and decide how to continue.

question: Which of the following might the Scrum Team discuss during a Sprint Retrospective?

options.B: Skills needed to improve the Development Team's ability to deliver
options.C: Methods of communication
options.D: The way the Scrum Team does Sprint Planning

answers: Its definition of “Done.” and Skills needed to improve the Development Team's ability to deliver and Methods of communication and The way the Scrum Team does Sprint Planning
explanation: All of the points are points to be discussed during Sprint Retrospective.

question: Why would you expect a Product Owner to care about the Development Team adhering to its definition of "Done"?

options.A: To forecast the team’s productivity over time
options.B: The Product Owner should not care about the definition of Done”, it is the Development Teams responsibility
options.C: To have complete transparency into what has been done at the end of each Sprint
options.D: To be able to punish the team when they don’t meet their velocity goal for the Sprint
options.E: The definition of “Done” can affect the product’s total cost of ownership

answers: To have complete transparency into what has been done at the end of each Sprint and The definition of “Done” can affect the product’s total cost of ownership
explanation: Team productivity cannot be forecasted by PO, punishing is not a valid act in Scrum, being a member of Scrum PO must be cared about definition of done.

question: Towards the end of the Sprint, the developers and yourself are debating if some of the Sprint Backlog Items were completed or not. The Scrum Master suggests to you and the developers to refer to the Definition of Done (DoD). Who should set up the DoD?

options.A: The Scrum Team unless the organization already has one. In that case, they should follow the Definition of Done as a minimum
options.B: The developers as they are the ones doing the actual work of converting the Sprint Backlog Items into an Increment
options.C: You as Product Owner have the authority to decide what is done and what is not
options.D: The Scrum Master as he/she knows how Scrum works and what fit best in an Agile environment

answers: The Scrum Team unless the organization already has one. In that case, they should follow the Definition of Done as a minimum
explanation: The Scrum Team unless the organization already has one. In that case, they should follow the Definition of Done as a minimum. DoD is a collective process.

question: Which statements are correct about a Sprint Backlog item that was not finished until the end of the Sprint? Select all correct answers.

options.A: It won't be demonstrated at the Sprint Review meeting
options.B: It must be completed in the next Sprint
options.C: It will be moved back to the Product Backlog
options.D: It will be demonstrated to the stakeholders but pointed out that its not complete yet
options.E: The Product Owner has to extend the Sprint until the item is done

answers: It won't be demonstrated at the Sprint Review meeting and It will be moved back to the Product Backlog
explanation: Only the 100% complete items are demonstrated, to avoid confusion. When something is not complete, it will be moved back to the Product Backlog. If it's still on the top of the Product Backlog, development will continue in the next Sprint (if it will be required)

question: The forecast is that we can't develop all items in the Sprint Backlog. Who reviews and makes decisions related to this issue?

options.B: The Developers and the Product Owner
options.C: The Business Analyst
options.D: The whole Scrum Team
options.E: The Solution Architect

answers: The Developers and the Product Owner
explanation: The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the Product Backlog but always can and must consider the feedback and opinion from other stakeholders including the Developers who can influence to add new items in Product Backlog. Good requirements should be brief enough, that’s why acceptance tests can be used to express many of the details that result from the conversations between customers, users, Product Owners and Developers, including non-functional requirements. One product only has one Product Backlog.

question: Who participates in the Sprint Review?

options.C: The Scrum Master
options.D: Senior Management
options.E: The Application Manager

answers: The Product Owner and The Developers and The Scrum Master and The Key Stakeholders
explanation:
The purpose of the Sprint Review is to inspect the outcome of the Sprint and determine future adaptations. The Scrum Team presents the results of their work to key stakeholders and progress toward the Product Goal is discussed.

The Scrum Team and stakeholders review what was accomplished in the Sprint and what has changed in their environment. Based on this information, attendees collaborate on what to do next. The Product Backlog may also be adjusted to meet new opportunities. It is not just a presentation but rather it is a working session.

question: Selena, a product owner for a scrum team, has refined the product backlog based on description, order, and size. John, a program manager with the PMO overseeing the group of projects Selena is working on & requested her to place a new item at the top of the product backlog. What should Selena do?

options.A: Selena should not be doing anything with the product backlog; this responsibility belongs to developers
options.B: Selena is accountable for the product backlog; so John doesn't have authority to request any new item or change the order product backlog
options.C: Selena must do as John has asked as John is an important stakeholder (PMO)
options.D: Selena may consider the request of others, but the final say as to the order is hers and hers alone

answers: Selena is accountable for the product backlog; so John doesn't have authority to request any new item or change the order product backlog

question: The Product Owner should communicate all of the marketplace knowledge & ever-changing landscape, environment to the Scrum Team. What is the best way for a Product Owner to communicate this to the Scrum Team ?

options.C: During Daily Scrums
options.D: During Sprint Review

answers: During Product Backlog Refinement and During Sprint Review
explanation:
The Product Owner communicates all of this marketplace knowledge to the Scrum Team through daily ad-hoc interactions as well as Product Backlog Refinement and in Sprint Reviews. During Product Backlog Refinement Product owner creates and clearly communicates Product Backlog items along with Product Goal. During Sprint review the Product Backlog may also be adjusted to meet new opportunities.

Sprint Retrospective & Daily Scrum are not the right forum to discuss this as Daily Scrum is for Developers & Sprint Retrospective is for inspecting the scrum team and creating a plan for improvements to be enacted during the next Sprint.

question: Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software is an Agile Principle. Which scrum practice helps the most in achieving this Agile objective?

options.C: Release Planning
options.D: Sprint Planning
options.E: Sprint Review

answers: Sprint
explanation: Sprint: Short Sprint Cycles. Having shorter sprints would enable teams to deliver early and the cycle of such deliveries would make it continuous delivery to the customer. Sprint planning is there irrespective of the sprint period.

question: Mark is a product owner for a scrum team. He decides for each sprint what items will go into the sprint backlog during sprint planning. He is growing increasingly frustrated with developers not able to complete the task items he has chosen for the sprint. What should Mark do to help developers reach the sprint goal?

options.A: Mark should work with the scrum master to find a resolution to this issue
options.B: Mark should encourage developers to work more hours, spending weekends if necessary working towards completing the sprint goal
options.C: Mark should work more closely with developers; items should not be added to the sprint backlog unless developers can commit to completing the items within the sprint
options.D: Mark should work to find more competent developers able to deliver what he decides for each sprint

answers: Mark should work more closely with developers; items should not be added to the sprint backlog unless developers can commit to completing the items within the sprint
explanation: During the Sprint no changes are made that would endanger the Sprint Goal. As developers work, it keeps the Sprint Goal in mind. In order to satisfy the Sprint Goal, it implements functionality and technology. If the work turns out to be different than developers expected, they collaborate with the Product Owner to negotiate the scope of Sprint Backlog within the Sprint. So Mark should work more closely with developers; items should not be added to the sprint backlog unless developers can commit to completing the items within the sprint

question: Scrum Teams are self-managed and cross-functional. How time-boxing promotes self-management?

options.A: Time-box does not allow enough time for stringent processes or meeting overhead
options.B: Time-box eliminates complexity due to organizational hierarchy
options.C: Time-box enables Scrum Team to determine the need for overtime as a percentage of the time-box
options.D: Time-box helps everyone to focus on the same problem at the same time
options.E: Time-box encourages team members who are closest to the problem to create the best possible solution in  the time allotted

answers: Time-box helps everyone to focus on the same problem at the same time and Time-box encourages team members who are closest to the problem to create the best possible solution in  the time allotted
explanation: Time-boxes help everyone focus on the same problem at the same time. Also, it encourages the people who are closest to the problem to create the best possible result in the time allotted, given the current context.

question: True or False, In large organizations multiple scrum teams work on the same product. In this scenario, does the Scrum Team use a single Product Backlog?
answers: Yes
explanation:
The Product Backlog is an emergent, ordered list of what is needed to improve the product. It is the single source of work undertaken by the Scrum Team.



Multiple Scrum Teams often work together on the same product. One Product Backlog is used to describe the upcoming work on the product i.e. it is a one to one relationship between Product and Product Backlog. In this scenario, they must mutually define and comply with the same Definition of Done.

question: Who is responsible for setting the timeboxed duration of Sprints?

options.C: The Scrum Team
options.D: The Development Manager
options.E: The Developers

answers: The Scrum Team
explanation: The only titles that we have in Scrum are Developers, Scrum Master and Product Owner. This is done by the whole Scrum Team, because they can contribute something important that leads to a better decision.

question: After Sprint Planning, the Product Owner finds that it makes sense to develop a new functionality.

options.A: Developers will add that to the Sprint Backlog
options.B: Developers can review that for selection in the next Sprint
options.C: Developers can swap existing functionality for the new functionality
options.D: Developers can create a technical spike & pull this to the current sprint

answers: Developers can review that for selection in the next Sprint
explanation: Product Owner can't introduce new functionality in the middle of the Sprint unless developers get more capacity to work and they mutually agree to take this in. After the Product Owner adds the new functionality and orders it to be on the top of the Product Backlog, developers can review that for selection in the next Sprint Planning.

question: In a Retrospective, a Scrum Team decides to revise the Sprint length. Pick the statements which are correct about Sprint length.

options.A: Sprint length can extend as long as required to complete all the work identified in Sprint Backlog
options.B: It is better to have Sprints of consistent length through Scrum journey
options.C: The new Sprint length needs to be agreed by the Product Owner
options.D: Sprint can have a maximum duration of one month

answers: It is better to have Sprints of consistent length through Scrum journey and The new Sprint length needs to be agreed by the Product Owner and Sprint can have a maximum duration of one month
explanation: The Product Owner needs to ensure that it is short enough to limit business risks and also short enough so the team can synchronize the development work with other business events. Please note that the finalized Sprint length cannot be longer than 1 calendar month.

question: James is a product owner for a scrum team. The customer has expressed concerns about releasing new software after every sprint. What should James do?

options.A: An increment must be released after a sprint James should insist on longer sprints to meet the customers longer release cycle
options.B: An increment only needs to be potentially releasable, James may hold back several increments and work with the customer on a release schedule that fits their needs
options.C: James should ask the scrum master to put together a release planning meeting to help convince the customer of the value of incremental release
options.D: An increment must be released after a sprint James should explain to the customer what scrum is and how scrum handles releases

answers: An increment only needs to be potentially releasable, James may hold back several increments and work with the customer on a release schedule that fits their needs
explanation: The Increment is the sum of all the Product Backlog items completed during a Sprint and the value of the increments of all previous Sprints. At the end of a Sprint, the new Increment must be "Done," which means it must be in usable condition and meet the Scrum Team's definition of "Done”. The increment must be in usable condition regardless of whether the Product Owner decides to release it.

question: Mark is a product owner for a scrum team. He wants to get some additional product backlog items added to the current sprint backlog. Sprint planning has already happened, what should Mark do?

options.A: Mark should bring it up at a daily scrum meeting and discuss it with developers; adding additional time to the daily scrum if needed
options.B: Mark should hold a separate meeting with developers and discuss the options of adding some additional items; developers can consider the possibility and may be able to accommodate the additional work
options.C: Mark should just add the items to the sprint backlog, the self managing Developers will figure out the best way to accommodate the additional work
options.D: Mark should consult with the scrum master; the scrum master will make the final call as to whether the work will be added to the current sprint

answers: Mark should hold a separate meeting with developers and discuss the options of adding some additional items; developers can consider the possibility and may be able to accommodate the additional work
explanation: The Sprint Backlog makes visible all the work that developers identify as necessary to meet the Sprint Goal. Developers modify the Sprint Backlog throughout the Sprint, and the Sprint Backlog emerges during the Sprint. This emergence occurs as developers work through the plan and learn more about the work needed to achieve the Sprint Goal. As new work is required, developers add it to the Sprint Backlog. As work is performed or completed, the estimated remaining work is updated. When elements of the plan are deemed unnecessary, they are removed. Only developers can change its Sprint Backlog during a Sprint. So Mark should discuss with Developers the possibility of accommodating this additional work.

question: Each Increment is additive to all prior Increments and thoroughly verified, ensuring that all Increments work together. Who has the final deciding authority on whether to release it or not?

options.C: The Scrum Master
options.D: The Scrum Team
options.E: The stakeholders

answers: The Scrum Team
explanation:
An Increment is a concrete stepping stone toward the Product Goal. Each Increment is additive to all prior Increments and thoroughly verified, ensuring that all Increments work together. In order to provide value, the Increment must be usable.



The Scrum Team is responsible for all product-related activities from stakeholder collaboration, verification, maintenance, operation, experimentation, research and development, and anything else that might be required. In the past, the Product Owner was the release decision-maker but now the release decision is on the whole scrum team.

question: The Developers find out during the Sprint that they are not likely to build everything they forecast. What would you expect a Product Owner to do?

options.C: Change the Sprint Goal
options.D: Renegotiate the selected Product Backlog items with the Developers
options.E: Inform management that more resources are needed

answers: Renegotiate the selected Product Backlog items with the Developers
explanation: During the Sprint. scope may be clarified and re-negotiated between the Product Owner and Developers as more is learned.

question: When does a Developer become accountable for the value of a Product Backlog item selected for the Sprint?

options.A: Never. The entire Scrum Team is accountable for creating value every Sprint
options.C: Whenever a team member can accommodate more work
options.D: At the Sprint Planning Event

answers: Never. The entire Scrum Team is accountable for creating value every Sprint
explanation: All members of the Scrum Team share in the accountability for creating value every Sprint.

question: True or false. Our velocity was 250 at the end of the 6th Sprint. It becomes 275 at the end of the 8th Sprint. Therefore, we're creating more value now compared to before.
answers: No
explanation: FALSE, There's no direct relationship between velocity (speed) and value; e.g., maybe we're working faster on less valuable items, in which case, velocity will be higher, but value may be the same, higher, or lower. Many people consider velocity as the most important criterion, but that's not true -- we should rather be focused on value, Sprint Goal, and Product Goal.

question: The Product Owner decides not to create a Product Goal. In this case select all correct answers.

options.A: It is up to the Product Owner
options.B: Changing the core design or ideas of Scrum, leaving out elements, or not following the rules of Scrum, covers up problems and limits the benefits of Scrum, potentially even rendering it useless
options.C: The Scrum Master is helping find techniques for effective Product Goal definition and Product Backlog management
options.D: The Product Owner must discuss with Developers and if they are ok with it, then he or she may remove the Product Goal

answers: Changing the core design or ideas of Scrum, leaving out elements, or not following the rules of Scrum, covers up problems and limits the benefits of Scrum, potentially even rendering it useless and The Scrum Master is helping find techniques for effective Product Goal definition and Product Backlog management
explanation: As we know from the Scrum Guide while implementing only parts of Scrum is possible (by removing the Product Goal), the result is not Scrum. Scrum exists only in its entirety and functions well as a container for other techniques, methodologies, and practices. In this case, the best action from the Scrum Master to discuss it with the Product Owner and find techniques for effective Product Goal definition

question: True or False. The key stakeholders are expected to participate in the Sprint Review
answers: Yes
explanation: The Scrum Team presents the results of their work to key stakeholders in the Sprint Review and progress toward the Product Goal is discussed.

question: What is the main responsibility of a tester in Scrum?

options.A: Writing the test scripts as soon as the programmers start working on the code
options.C: There are no testers in Scrum
options.D: Verifying the work of Developers

answers: There are no testers in Scrum
explanation: There are no members titled as testers, because we don't have extra accountabilities and titles in Scrum. However, there can be Developers who are experts in testing. Remember that everyone is called a Developer. When you see a statement like "Developer with testing expertise" in your real exam, it usually means "tester" as an accountability or title, rather than a person who's expert in testing.

question: The Product Backlog is the single source of requirements for any changes to be made to the product. How should a Product Backlog item be refined when it is located at the top? Select all correct answers?

options.A: It should be clear which developer is responsible for it
options.B: In a way that it can be,“Done” in the timeboxed duration of one Sprint
options.C: In a way that's clear enough for the developers
options.D: All the tasks required for completing it should be identified

answers: In a way that it can be,“Done” in the timeboxed duration of one Sprint and In a way that's clear enough for the developers
explanation: Items at the top of the Product Backlog should be small enough to fit in one Sprint. They should also be clear and detailed enough; but not too detailed (e.g. not with all the tasks identified), as it would be upfront planning. Tasks are created gradually during the Sprint. Product Backlog items require multiple expertise and are usually done by multiple developers. Therefore, they are not assigned. Tasks, however, are assigned to the individual developers, while everyone stays accountable.

question: Why should there be only one Product Owner per product?

options.A: There should be one Product Owner for each team. If more than one team is working on the same product, multiple Product Owners might be needed
options.B: Developers know who’s responsible for prioritization
options.C: One person ¡s always enough for this role
options.D: It becomes confusing when more than one Product Owner ¡s managing the team

answers: Developers know who’s responsible for prioritization
explanation: The Product Owner is one person, not a committee. The Product Owner may represent the desires of a committee in the Product Backlog, but those wanting to change a Product Backlog item’s priority must address the Product Owner. For the Product Owner to succeed, the entire organization must respect his or her decisions. The Product Owner’s decisions are visible in the content and ordering of the Product Backlog. No one can force Developers to work from a different set of requirements and developers know who’s responsible for prioritization.

question: This accountability in Scrum must know the most about the product and performance of the product?

options.C: The Product Owner
options.D: The project manager
options.E: The Product Master

answers: The Product Owner
explanation: Measuring the release or product performance is the Product Owner's responsibility. Measuring Sprint performance is the responsibility of Developers.

question: What of the following are key factors within the Scrum Team to organize themselves?

options.A: Having all the competencies required to accomplish the work without depending on others
options.B: They should be transparent to the Team Lead
options.C: They should be self-managed
options.D: They should make sure that they have frequent meetings with the software architects

answers: Having all the competencies required to accomplish the work without depending on others and They should be self-managed
explanation: The Scrum Team should be self-managing and cross-functional and they should find the best to accomplish their work, rather than being directed by others outside the team.

question: The main goal for the Product Owner is to maximize the value of the product. But how should the Product Owner forecast the completion date?

options.A: By any method the PO finds appropriate
options.B: By dividing the remaining amount of work in the Product Backlog to the latest calculated velocity
options.C: By using a trend line in the burn-down chart
options.D: It is not the responsibility of the Product Owner. The Scrum Master must forecast the completion date

answers: By any method the PO finds appropriate
explanation: Using a trend line in the burn-down chart can help (if the team is using that chart), as well as simple or complex formulas such as the one mentioned above. But all of these are just guides for the Product Owner and she should consider all factors and come up with a reliable completion date forecast.

question: In Scrum, when a Product Backlog item or an Increment is described as "Done", everyone in the team must understand what "Done" means. From the following answers, choose the LEAST accurate statement about the Definition of "Done"?

options.B: The Scrum Team may define it
options.C: It may vary depending on the product
options.D: It may evolve during the product life

answers: The Product Owner creates it
explanation: The DoD is not created by the Product Owner. If the Definition of Done for an increment is part of the standards of the organization, all Scrum Teams must follow it as a minimum. If it is not an organizational standard, the Scrum Team must create a Definition of Done appropriately for the product.

question: True or False. The Product Owner should be expertly aware of the marketplace for the product.

options.C: It depends

answers: Yes
explanation: Product Owner should be expertly aware of the marketplace for the product. They should constantly be gathering and re-gathering information and data regarding the marketplace so that the product value is maximized. Getting out of touch with the marketplace can be a recipe for product disaster.

question: True or False. The Product Owner is the sole person accountable for managing the Product Backlog.
answers: Yes
explanation:
The Product Owner is accountable for effective Product Backlog management, which includes:

Developing and explicitly communicating the Product Goal; Creating and clearly communicating Product Backlog items; Ordering Product Backlog items; and, Ensuring that the Product Backlog is transparent, visible and understood.

question: Select 2 true statements about Scrum?

options.A: Scrum is a methodology for managing complex projects
options.B: Scrum is a traditional process but with Sprints and related artifacts
options.C: Scrum is a framework  for developing and maintaining complex products
options.D: Scrum is based on empirical process control theory

answers: Scrum is a framework  for developing and maintaining complex products and Scrum is based on empirical process control theory
explanation: Scrum is a framework, not a methodology or body of knowledge. Scrum is empirical, rather than theoretical. Scrum is more about project delivery rather than project management. Scrum is adaptive, rather than predictive (it's more than just using Sprints and related artifacts). Scrum should be used entirely (we do not tailor it)

question: During the Sprint Review, the Scrum Team and stakeholders collaborate about what was done in the Sprint. The stakeholders are invited to the Sprint Review in order to:

options.B: Provide feedback on the team working style
options.C: Provide feedback on Scrum implementation
options.D: Provide feedback on the Increment
options.E: Provide feedback on design and architecture

answers: Provide feedback on Scrum implementation
explanation: During the Sprint Review, the Scrum Team and stakeholders collaborate about what was done in the Sprint. Based on that and any changes to the Product Backlog during the Sprint, attendees collaborate on the next things that could be done to optimize value. This is an informal meeting, not a status meeting, and the presentation of the Increment is intended to elicit feedback and foster collaboration.

question: The Product Backlog Refinement is not a mandatory event in Scrum. However, almost all Scrum Teams are holding this event. From the following answers select all correct benefits of the Product Backlog Refinement?

explanation:
In general there are 6 important benefits of the PBR. Here they are:

●      Increase transparency

●      Clarify value

●      Break things into consumable pieces

●      Reduce dependencies

●      Forecasting

●      Incorporate learning

question: A stakeholder is a person external to the Scrum Team with a specific interest in and knowledge of a product that is required for incremental discovery. Who are the typical key stakeholders in Scrum? Select all correct answers.

options.A: The people responsible for making the funding decisions for the product development effort
options.B: The people responsible for product marketing
options.C: The people who actually use the product under development
options.D: The people responsible for paying to use the product
options.E: The people responsible for product development
options.F: The people from the security department

answers: The people responsible for making the funding decisions for the product development effort and The people who actually use the product under development and The people responsible for paying to use the product
explanation: Typical stakeholder is the man who is responsible for making the funding decisions for the product development effort, the user of the product, the man who is responsible for paying to use the product

question: Which of the following is the LEAST productive way for the Scrum Master to improve communication between Developers and the Product Owner?

options.A: Giving the order to all members of the team and act as a go-between for them
options.B: Suggest effective communication tools and techniques to the Product Owner
options.C: Monitor their communication performance
options.D: Teach them how to communicate effectively

answers: Giving the order to all members of the team and act as a go-between for them
explanation: Acting as a go-between weakens the team. Also, the Scrum Master is not the team leader (in people management), he or she can't manage the team and give any order. But The Scrum Master is supposed to teach and coach and be the leader in serving the team.

question: One of the most challenging activities in Scrum is Product Backlog Refinement (although the PBR is not an event in Scrum). How should a Product Backlog item be refined before its development begins? Select all correct answers.

options.A: In a way that it's clear enough for Developers
options.B: It should be clear which member of the Scrum Team is responsible for it
options.C: In a way that it can be “Done in the time-boxed duration of one Sprint
options.D: All the tasks required for completing it should be identified

answers: In a way that it's clear enough for Developers and In a way that it can be “Done in the time-boxed duration of one Sprint
explanation: A Product Backlog should be refined in a way that it's clear enough for Developers and it can be "Done" in the time-boxed duration of one Sprint

question: Which two statements are correct during the Sprint?

options.A: The scope may be clarified as more is learned
options.B: Some Sprint Backlog items will be replaced with items from the Product Backlog if the priorities change
options.C: The scope may be re-negotiated as more is learned
options.D: Some Sprint Backlog items would be moved back to the Product Backlog to be completed in future Sprints

answers: The scope may be clarified as more is learned and The scope may be re-negotiated as more is learned
explanation: During the Sprint: No changes are made that would endanger the Sprint Goal; Quality goals do not decrease; and, Scope may be clarified and re-negotiated between the Product Owner and Developers as more is learned.

question: The most important stakeholder wants a new feature to be added to the current Sprint. What is the best response for Developers in this situation?

options.A: Ask the Product Owner to work with the customer
options.C: Add the item to the bottom of the Sprint Backlog
options.D: Swap the item with one of the items in the Sprint Backlog
options.E: Add the item to the Product Backlog

answers: Ask the Product Owner to work with the customer
explanation: No one can add additional items to the Product Backlog (source for development work) except the Product Owner. First stakeholder has to discuss it with the Product Owner

question: How many Product Goals can a Scrum team have at a moment?

options.C: Unlimited numbers of Product Goals

answers: No more than 1 Product Goal
explanation: You can only have one Product Goal, so when the current Product Goal is achieved a new one would be created. If there is a significant change in context and the current Product Goal has not been achieved then the Scrum Team would replace the Product Goal with a more fitting one. If the Product is no longer relevant in the market (remember floppy disks, video cassettes, etc ), then the organization would either pivot or fold.

question: A Definition of Done drives the quality of work and is used to assess when a task has been completed. But what are the benefits of having tests in the definition of “Done”? Select all correct answers.

options.A: Increments would be closer to being potentially shippable
options.B: Increased transparency and the quality of the Increments
options.C: Increments would be more complete
options.D: Reporting would be easier for the project manager

answers: Increments would be closer to being potentially shippable and Increased transparency and the quality of the Increments and Increments would be more complete
explanation:
Developers deliver an Increment of product functionality every Sprint. This Increment is usable, so a Product Owner may choose to immediately release it. If the definition of "Done" for an increment is part of the conventions, standards or guidelines of the development organization, all Scrum Teams must follow it as a minimum. If "Done" for an increment is not a convention of the development organization, Developers of the Scrum Team must define a definition of "Done" appropriate for the product. If there are multiple Scrum Teams working on the system or product release, Developers on all Scrum Teams must mutually define the definition of "Done". Each Increment is additive to all prior Increments and thoroughly tested, ensuring that all Increments work together.



As Scrum Teams mature, it is expected that their definitions of "Done" will expand to include more stringent criteria for higher quality. New definitions, as used, may uncover work to be done in previously “Done” increments. A product or system should have a definition of "Done" that is a standard for any work done on it.

question: The Scrum Team has just finished the Sprint Planning. According to this, choose all correct statements from the following answers?

options.A: After the Sprint Planning, a Sprint cannot proceed without complete requirement specification
options.B: After the Sprint Planning, a Sprint cannot proceed  without a Sprint Goal
options.C: After the Sprint complete Sprint Planning, a Sprint can proceed without Backlog
options.D: After the Sprint Planning, a Sprint cannot proceed without complete design and BRD or FSD

answers: After the Sprint Planning, a Sprint cannot proceed  without a Sprint Goal and After the Sprint complete Sprint Planning, a Sprint can proceed without Backlog
explanation: The Sprint Goal is an objective set for the Sprint that can be met through the implementation of Product Backlog. It provides guidance to Developers on why they are building the increment. It is created during the Sprint Planning meeting. As new work is required, Developers add it to the Sprint Backlog. As work is performed or completed, the estimated remaining work is updated. When elements of the plan are deemed unnecessary, they are removed.

question: According to the Scrum Guide, that is the reason why the Daily Scrum should be held at the same time and the same place?

options.A: It makes easier to book the rooms
options.B: Because the place can be named
options.C: Because the Product Owner requires it
options.D: To reduce complexity and overheat

answers: To reduce complexity and overheat
explanation: The Daily Scrum is held at the same time and place each day to reduce complexity.

question: According to the Scrum Guide, Scrum is founded on empiricism and lean thinking. What else is true about Scrum? Select all correct answers.

options.A: Scrum is a methodology for managing complex projects
options.B: Scrum is a traditional process but with Sprints and related artifacts
options.C: Scrum is a framework for developing and maintaining complex products
options.D: Scrum employs an iterative, incremental approach to optimize predictability and control risk

answers: Scrum is a framework for developing and maintaining complex products and Scrum employs an iterative, incremental approach to optimize predictability and control risk
explanation: Scrum is a lightweight framework that helps people, teams and organizations generate value through adaptive solutions for complex problems. Scrum employs an iterative, incremental approach to optimize predictability and control risk. Scrum engages groups of people who collectively have all the skills and expertise to do the work and share or acquire such skills as needed.

question: During a Sprint Review, stakeholders notice that the product development progress is not clearly visible and lacks transparency. Moreover, they are not able to understand the next steps. Who is responsible for this?

options.C: Scrum Master
options.D: Scrum Team

answers: Product Owner
explanation: The PO ensures that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the Scrum Team will work on next. The Product Owner is the Lead Facilitator of Key Stakeholder Involvement. The PO is responsible for identifying the key stakeholders for the product and involving them as necessary throughout the development effort.

question: The Scrum Team consists of the PO, SM and Developers. One of the responsibilities of Scrum Master is to find, track and help remove different obstacles. But who supports the Scrum Master in removing obstacles?

options.C: The senior Developer
options.D: Developers

answers: The senior management and Developers
explanation: Developers can help the Scrum Master because of their understanding of how the work is done. Some impediments are rooted in external causes, and that’s why the Scrum Master might need to have the senior management's support in removing them

question: True or False. The Product Backlog is baselined at the beginning of the project?
answers: No
explanation: There is no such action in Scrum as baselining the product backlog

question: The role of Scrum Master in Sprint Retrospective is: Choose only one best answer.

options.C: None of the above
options.D: Business analyst

answers: None of the above
explanation: The Scrum Master participates as a peer team member in the meeting from the accountability over the Scrum process, As a team member, the Scrum Master (tike any other member} identifies the most helpful changes to improve the effectiveness of the Scrum Team

question: True or False. According to the Scrum Guide, the Product Owner can transfer some of his/her accountability to Developers.
answers: No

question: The Product Owner has some problems with managing the Product Backlog. What is the right action from the Scrum Master in this situation?

options.A: Extend the Sprint so that the Product Owner has more time to order items
options.B: Help the Product Owner to find techniques for effective Product Goal definition and Product Backlog management
options.C: Ask Developers help the Product Owner understand the dependencies among items to be used in ordering them
options.D: Ask the stakeholder to change the Product Owner

answers: Help the Product Owner to find techniques for effective Product Goal definition and Product Backlog management

question: There are many responsibilities in Scrum for the Product Owner. From the following answers choose three of them .Choose all answers that apply.

options.A: Break down epic items into smaller ones
options.B: Create user stories (if the Scrum Team uses user story format as a task)
options.C: Prioritize the Product Backlog
options.D: Design Software
options.E: Facilitate meetings

answers: Break down epic items into smaller ones and Create user stories (if the Scrum Team uses user story format as a task) and Prioritize the Product Backlog
explanation: Designing the software is part of the development and should be done by the developers. They make technical decisions, and volunteer for tasks (assign them to themselves). Estimation is the responsibility of the developers because they are the people who will develop the item. The rest (from the following) are done by the Product Owner.

question: During the Sprint Review, the Scrum Team and stakeholders collaborate about what was done in the Sprint. The stakeholders are invited to the Sprint Review in order to:

options.B: Provide feedback on the team working style
options.C: Provide feedback on Scrum implementation
options.D: Provide feedback on the Increment
options.E: Provide feedback on design and architecture

answers: Provide feedback on Scrum implementation
explanation: During the Sprint Review, the Scrum Team and stakeholders collaborate about what was done in the Sprint. Based on that and any changes to the Product Backlog during the Sprint, attendees collaborate on the next things that could be done to optimize value. This is an informal meeting, not a status meeting, and the presentation of the Increment is intended to elicit feedback and foster collaboration.

question: When is an item in the Sprint Backlog considered complete?

options.A: When there’s nothing more we need to do before it can be used by end users
options.C: When the whole Scrum Team agrees that it’s complete
options.D: When user acceptance tests are passed

answers: When there’s nothing more we need to do before it can be used by end users
explanation: The Scrum Team can't agree that it's complete, there's a limit to self-management. It's possible to not even start working on an item before the Sprint is over, so you can't call it complete. A Product Backlog item that you have in the Sprint Backlog is Done, when it can be part of a Done Increment. Increments have to be Done based on the Definition of Done.

question: Which of the following are needed in order to allow Sprint Planning to begin?

options.B: A clear cadence of when the Daily Scrum will take place
options.C: A Product Backlog with the most important items ready for discussion
options.D: Formal budget approval to conduct another Sprint
options.E: A Product Goal communicated by the Product Owner
options.F: A clear and non-negotiable Sprint Goal

answers: A Product Backlog with the most important items ready for discussion and A Product Goal communicated by the Product Owner
explanation: Sprint Planning initiates the Sprint by laying out the work to be performed for the Sprint. This resulting plan is created by the collaborative work of the entire Scrum Team. The Product Owner ensures that attendees are prepared to discuss the most important Product Backlog items and how they map to the Product Goal.

question: How important is it for a Product Owner to order Product Backlog items by using value points?

options.A: Using value points is the ultimate way for a Product Owner to predict the value that the product will provide
options.B: Calculating value points ¡s a predictive approach that conflicts with the empiricism of Scrum, and is therefore not acceptable
options.C: The Product Owner may order the Product Backlog by using value points or select another technique, the  decision is up to them

answers: The Product Owner may order the Product Backlog by using value points or select another technique, the  decision is up to them
explanation: The Product Owner is accountable for ordering the Product backlog, regardless of the techniques they may utilize to define that order. Indications of value on Product Backlog items may be useful but are only a prediction until validated by users and the market.

question: When can the Product Backlog be updated?

options.A: Never, unless agreed to by the change request
options.B: Only after a Sprint Review if agreed to by the stakeholders
options.C: At any time when done by the Product Owner or a  delegate
options.D: Only during Product Backlog refinement sessions if the Product Owner is present

answers: At any time when done by the Product Owner or a  delegate
explanation: The Product Backlog is dynamic: it constantly changes to identify what the product needs in order to be appropriate, competitive, and useful. Product Backlog items can be updated at any time by the Product Owner or a delegate. Even if the responsibility is delegated the Product Owner remains accountable for the Product Backlog.

question: Which two statements explain why the Definition of Done is important to the Product Owner?

options.A: It identifies undone work that can be addressed in a separate Sprint
options.B: It creates transparency regarding progress within the  Scrum Team
options.C: It helps the Product Owner track the open work during a Sprint
options.D: It establishes the expected quality of the Increment reviewed at the Sprint Review

answers: It creates transparency regarding progress within the  Scrum Team and It establishes the expected quality of the Increment reviewed at the Sprint Review
explanation: All Scrum Team members must have a shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete. to ensure transparency. This is the Definition of Done for the Scrum Team and is used to assess when work is complete on the product Increment. The Increment reviewed at the Sprint Review must meet the Definition of Done.

question: The Product Owner's authority to change and update the Product Backlog is unlimited, except for:

options.A: Decisions by the chief program manager
options.B: Technical and architectural work that needs to be done first, as indicated by the chief enterprise architect
options.C: Decisions by the CFO, the CEO or the board of directors

explanation: Everyone in the Team and in the organization must respect PO decisions.

question: What is the principal value of releasing an Increment?

options.A: To learn about the Scrum Team’s productivity
options.B: To validate assumptions made when developing the product
options.C: To learn about the forecast of functionality that was developed

answers: To validate assumptions made when developing the product
explanation: Releasing the Increment to customers/users is the only way to validate assumptions about value.

question: How does an organization know that a product built using Scrum is successful?

options.A: By releasing frequently, and measuring the value customers/users experience
options.B: By measuring that velocity has increased since the last release
options.C: By measuring the actual time spent on development versus the time estimated for development
options.D: By the Product Owner and stakeholders accepting the Increment at the Sprint Review

answers: By releasing frequently, and measuring the value customers/users experience
explanation: Scrum Teams deliver products iteratively and incrementally, maximizing opportunities for feedback. If a product is not released. the opportunity to capture user and market feedback is lost.

question: What are typical activities for a Product Owner in a Sprint?

options.A: Create financial reporting upon the spent hours reported by the Scrum Team
options.B: Collaborate with stakeholders, user communities, and subject matter experts
options.C: Update the work plan for the Developers on a daily basis
options.D: Attend every Daily Scrum to answer functional questions on the discussed Sprint Backlog items

explanation: The Product Owner represents the needs of many stakeholders in the Product Backlog. This typically requires active interaction in order to be able to represent stakeholders and their needs. Product Backlog refinement is an ongoing process in which the Product Owner and the Developers may collaborate on the details of Product Backlog items.

question: What best describes the relationship of the Product Owner and the stakeholders?

options.A: The Product Owner writes the User Stories as provided by the stakeholders
options.B: The Product Owner provides the stakeholders with acceptance forms at the Sprint Review to record their formal agreement over the delivered software
options.C: The Product Owner has the final call over the requirements and should involve the stakeholders as little as possible
options.D: The Product Owner actively asks for stakeholder input and expectations to incorporate into the Product Backlog

explanation: The Product Owner represents the stakeholders to the Scrum Team. which includes representing their desired requirements in the Product Backlog. question: Adaptation requires regular inspection. In what ways does the Product Owner contribute to the results achieved by inspection?

options.A: The Product Owner inspects the Sprint burn-down at the Daily Scrum for progress towards a complete Increment and re-planning the team's work
options.B: The Product Owner invites stakeholders to the Sprint Review to learn how the current state of the marketplace influences what is the most valuable thing to do next
options.C: The Product Owner verifies the Sprint Backlog for completeness at the end of Sprint Planning in order to allow the Sprint to start
options.D: The Product Owner shares the current state of Product Backlog at the Sprint Review, which, combined with the  inspection of the Increment leads to an updated Product Backlog

answers: The Product Owner invites stakeholders to the Sprint Review to learn how the current state of the marketplace influences what is the most valuable thing to do next and The Product Owner shares the current state of Product Backlog at the Sprint Review, which, combined with the  inspection of the Increment leads to an updated Product Backlog
explanation: Scrum users must frequently inspect Scrum artifacts and progress to detect undesirable variances. The primary tool for the Product Owner to uphold transparency is the Product Backlog. Product Backlog is a living artifact that is actively maintained and updated to reflect reality. At the Sprint Review, attendees collaborate on the next things that could be done to optimize value. which is processed into an updated Product Backlog.

question: To what extent does technical debt limit the value a Product Owner can get from a product?

options.A: Technical debt causes a greater percentage of the product's budget to be spent on maintenance of the product
options.B: The velocity at which new functionality can be created is reduced when you have technical debt
options.C: Technical debt is not a Product Owner concern, technical debt is only an issue for the Developers
options.D: Technical debt does not influence the delivery of value

answers: Technical debt causes a greater percentage of the product's budget to be spent on maintenance of the product and The velocity at which new functionality can be created is reduced when you have technical debt
explanation: Technical debt does influence and it is a concern of the PO.

question: True or False: A first Sprint can start before the Product Owner has a complete and exhaustive Product Backlog in place.
answers: Yes
explanation: A first Sprint requires no more than a Scrum Team and enough ideas to potentially complete a full Sprint.

question: How do timeboxes help the Product Owner and the other members of the Scrum Team validate assumptions, adapt, and maximize the value of their product?

options.A: Timeboxes help by making sure a Sprint does not stop until all testing is done, and the work is verified by the Product Owner
options.B: Timeboxes assure the Product Owner that the Developers will finish all work on the Sprint Backlog by the end of the Sprint
options.C: At the end of each Sprint when the timebox expires a detailed report with all test cases and test results is available
options.D: Timeboxes help minimize risk by creating the opportunity to validate assumptions using feedback from users and the market; allowing Scrum Teams to inspect progress toward the Product Goal and decide whether to pivot or persevere

answers: Timeboxes help minimize risk by creating the opportunity to validate assumptions using feedback from users and the market; allowing Scrum Teams to inspect progress toward the Product Goal and decide whether to pivot or persevere
explanation: The Product Owner manages the Product Backlog against the assumption that value will be generated. This assumption remains invalidated when not checked against users and the market. When a Sprints horizon is too long. you increase the risk that what is being developed may no longer be desired. Sprints limit risk to one calendar month or less of work.

question: Which statement best describes Scrum here?

options.A: A cookbook that defines best practices for software development
options.B: A defined and predictive process that conforms to the principles of Scientific Management
options.C: A framework for creating complex products in complex environments
options.D: A complete methodology that defines how to develop software

answers: A framework for creating complex products in complex environments
explanation: Scrum is a lightweight framework that helps people. teams and organizations generate value through adaptive solutions for complex problems.

question: Who is required to attend the Daily Scrum?

options.C: The Scrum Team
options.D: The Scrum Master and Product Owner
options.E: The Developers and Scrum Master

explanation: Only the people doing the work described on the Sprint Backlog need to inspect and adapt at the Daily Scrum. If the Product Owner or Scrum Master are actively working on items in the Sprint Backlog. they participate as Developers, they will need to be at the Daily Scrum.

question: The Product Owner can also be a Developer.

explanation: According to the Scrum Guide, one person can have more than one accountabilities. It's not recommended, but it's not forbidden either. It is acceptable because some of the small projects may need to use a few people to do multiple things, but they have to make sure that they are paying attention to all responsibilities that they have for each accountability.

question: Select the Scrum Pillars.

options.B: Individuals and Iteration, Working Software, Customer Collaboration, Responding to Change
options.C: Transparency, Inspection, Adaptation
options.D: Commitment, Courage, Focus, Openness, Respect

answers: Transparency, Inspection, Adaptation
explanation: The Scrum Theory Pillars named in the Scrum guide are Transparency, Inspection, Adaptation. The Scrum values are Commitment, Courage, Focus, Openness, Respect.

question: The Developers should not be interrupted during the Sprint and the Sprint Goal should remain intact. These are conditions that foster creativity, quality and productivity. (Which one of the following answers is FALSE?)

options.A: The Developers may work with the Product Owner to remove or add work if it finds it has more or less capacity than it expected
options.B: As a decomposition of the selected Product Backlog items, the Sprint Backlog changes and may grow as the work emerges
options.C: The Sprint Backlog is fully formulated in the Sprint  Planning event and does not change during the Sprint
options.D: The Product Owner can help clarify or optimize the Sprint when asked by the Developers

explanation: The Sprint Backlog makes visible all of the work that the Developers identify as necessary to meet the Sprint Goal. The Developers modify the Sprint Backlog throughout the Sprint, and the Sprint Backlog emerges during the Sprint.

question: The Developers should have all the skills needed to:

options.A: Do all of the development work, except for specialized testing that requires additional tools and environments
options.B: Turn the Product Backlog items they select into an Increment of useful and valuable product functionality
options.C: Complete the project as estimated when the date and cost are committed to the Product Owner

answers: Turn the Product Backlog items they select into an Increment of useful and valuable product functionality
explanation: The Developers are a group of professionals who do the work of delivering an Increment of done product at the end of each Sprint. As a team. Developers have all of the skills necessary to create a product Increment.

question: True or False: Scrum has a role called "project manager."
answers: No
explanation: A Scrum Team has a Scrum Master, a Product Owner and Developers. As a whole they have all controls needed.

question: When should the Developers on a Scrum Team be replaced?

options.A: Every Sprint to promote shared learning
options.B: As needed, with no special allowance for changes in productivity
options.C: Never, it reduces productivity
options.D: As needed, while taking into account a short-term reduction in productivity

answers: As needed, while taking into account a short-term reduction in productivity
explanation: Scrum Teams typically go through some steps before achieving a state of increased performance. Changing membership typically reduces cohesion, affecting performance and productivity in the short term.

question: What is the recommended size for a Scrum Team?

options.C: 7 plus or minus 2
options.D: Typically 10 or fewer people

answers: Typically 10 or fewer people
explanation: A Scrum Team is small enough to remain nimble and large enough to complete significant work within a Sprint, typically 10 or fewer people. Generally smaller teams communicate better and are more productive

question: The timebox for the Sprint Planning event is?

options.C: Monthly
options.D: 8 hours for a monthly Sprint For shorter Sprints it is usually shorter

answers: 8 hours for a monthly Sprint For shorter Sprints it is usually shorter
explanation: Sprint Planning is timeboxed to a maximum of eight hours for a one-month Sprint. For shorter Sprints, the event is usually shorter.

question: True or False. Once the Sprint starts, the length shouldn't change.
answers: Yes
explanation: Once the Sprint starts, its duration is fixed and cannot change.

question: The CEO asks the Developers to add a “very important” item to a Sprint that is in progress. What should the Developers do?

options.A: Inform the other members of the Scrum Team so the team can decide what to do
options.B: Add the item to the next Sprint
options.C: Add the item to the current Sprint and drop an item of equal size
options.D: Add the item to the current Sprint without any adjustments

answers: Inform the other members of the Scrum Team so the team can decide what to do

question: How much work must the Developers complete for each Product Backlog item they select for a Sprint?

options.A: All development work and at least some testing
options.B: Analysis, design, programming, testing and documentation
options.C: Enough so that each Product Backlog item they select meets the Definition of Done
options.D: As much as it can fit into the Sprint

answers: Enough so that each Product Backlog item they select meets the Definition of Done
explanation: The purpose of each Sprint is to deliver useful and valuable Increments that adhere to the Scrum Team's current Definition of Done.

question: During a Sprint, a Developer determines that the Scrum Team will not be able to complete the items in their forecast. Who should be present to review and adjust the Product Backlog items selected?

options.A: The Product Owner and all stakeholders
options.B: The Scrum Master, the project manager, and the Developers
options.C: The Product Owner and the Developers
options.D: The Developers

answers: The Product Owner and the Developers
explanation: During the Sprint. scope may be clarified and re-negotiated between the Product Owner and the Developers as more is learned. It is important to be transparent when challenges arise since ultimately the entire Scrum Team is accountable for creating a valuable, useful Increment.

question: What are two ways a Scrum Master serves to enable effective Scrum Teams?

options.A: By removing impediments that hinder the Scrum Team
options.B: By keeping high value features high in the Product Backlog
options.C: By starting and ending the meetings at the proper time
options.D: By facilitating Developer decision-making

answers: By removing impediments that hinder the Scrum Team and By facilitating Developer decision-making
explanation: The Scrum Master serves the Scrum Team in several ways. Facilitation and removing impediments are examples of ways a Scrum Master helps a team become more effective.

question: True or False. It's required to use Story Points in Scrum.
answers: No
explanation: It's a good idea to use Story Points to estimate the Product Backlog items, but it's not mandatory in Scrum.

question: Which of the following apse might help the Product Owner minimize waste in developing and sustaining the Product Backlog?

options.A: Only fully describe Product Backlog items when it seems likely they will be implemented
options.B: Write every  Product Backlog item clearly and with no ambiguity
options.C: Hand off ownership of the Product Backlog to someone else
options.D: Remove items from the Product Backlog that have not been addressed in a long time

answers: Only fully describe Product Backlog items when it seems likely they will be implemented and Write every  Product Backlog item clearly and with no ambiguity
explanation: Hand off ownership of the Product Backlog to someone else, Remove items from the Product Backlog that have not been addressed in a long time are simply not an option and incorrect in scrum framework.

question: True or False. When multiple teams are working on the same product, their Sprints should start and end at the same time.
answers: No
explanation: FALSE, it's not mandatory to start and end the Sprints at the same time; e.g., most teams have four-week Sprints, but some of them have two-week Sprints.

question: Which of the following statements are correct about non-functional requirements?

options.A: They will be in the Sprint Backlog, but not the Product Backlog
options.B: They should be incorporated into every increment

question: Developers are free to change their engineering and testing practices whenever they want?

question: From the following answers, choose one which is not a prioritization technique?

explanation: Planning poker, also called Scrum poker, is a consensus-based, gamified technique for estimating, mostly used to estimate the effort or relative size of development goals in software development. By hiding the figures in this way, the group can avoid the cognitive bias of anchoring, where the first number spoken aloud sets a precedent for subsequent estimates. question: True or False. After Scrum implementation, the Scrum Team ensures the exception of technical debt.

question: According to the Scrum Guide, the Scrum is based on: (Select all correct answers)

question: Who should know the most about the release and product requirements in Scrum?

question: True or False. Scrum is a software development methodology.

question: Which of the following is not a pillar of Scrum?

question: The Team may decrease the technical debt by _________________.

question: The benefits of having a solid product vision are:

question: What is unrealized value in Scrum?

question: Some of the Sprint Backlog items were not completed and some were completed during the Sprint. What should happen with completed items when the Sprint is canceled?

question: From the following statements choose one or more correct answers about the Daily Scrum?
