This is the Definition of Done for the Scrum Team and is used to assess when work is complete on the product Increment. In self-managed teams creativity thrives, conflicts can be resolved, and new possibilities are explored.

question: A Stakeholder requests from the Product Owner to push forward a specific Product Backlog item, but the Product Owner knows that it is not that valuable and decides not to build it anytime soon. Which Scrum Values are the Product Owner showing? (Select the best two answers)

options.C: Passion
options.D: Transparency
options.E: Courage

answers: Courage and Focus
explanation: Successful use of Scrum depends on people becoming more proficient in living five values: Commitment, Focus, Openness, Respect, and Courage.

question: A Scrum Team of 6 members is working on building a new application to support Payroll processes in their organization. Darren is a new Developer and he added an additional feature in the Increment which is not part of the Product Backlog. He did it because he was approached directly by one of the business stakeholders and only took him 30 min to implement the requirements. This was discovered just before the Sprint Review by other Developers. What should the Developers do? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: The Developers should retain the feature in the Increment but do not present it to the stakeholders
options.B: Darren should ask the Product Owner to add this feature to the Product Backlog because it is already part of the Increment
options.C: The Developers should remove the feature from the Increment
options.D: The Developers should inform the Scrum Master about the request and remove Darren from the Team
options.E: They should discuss the issue in the Sprint Retrospective

answers: The Developers should remove the feature from the Increment and They should discuss the issue in the Sprint Retrospective
explanation: As per the Scrum Guide, "The Product Backlog is an ordered list of what is needed to improve the product. It is the single source of work undertaken by the Scrum Team. Since the requirement did not originate from Product Backlog, it must be removed from the Increment. The team should also discuss this matter in the Sprint Retrospective so that everyone is aware of this rule. It is not justifiable to add this requirement in the Product Backlog just because it is already part of the Increment. Scrum Teams must follow the Scrum Values. Everything the team does should be transparent. Hiding the information from the Product Owner is not a good approach. Scrum Master does not remove individuals from the team for these kinds of mistakes. Scrum Master understands that mistakes are expected but the Team should learn from it.

question: Which element is not an attribute of Product Backlog items?

options.C: Order
options.D: Description

answers: Owner
explanation: Product Backlog refinement is the act of breaking down and further defining Product Backlog items into smaller more precise items. This is an ongoing activity to add details, such as a description, order, and size. Attributes often vary with the domain of work.

question: True or False. Lower positioned, Product Backlog items, are usually larger and less clear than those on the top.
answers: Yes
explanation: When Product Backlog is created, items are added to it. They have different sizes and eventually are ordered on their business value. The most valued items will be on the top and usually, these items would be broken down into smaller ones. We don’t do this with those items on the bottom. That’s why usually larger and less clear items are on the bottom of the Product Backlog.

question: The Sprint Backlog includes _______________

options.C: Use Cases
options.D: All answers apply, since are a decomposition of the selected Product Backlog items
options.E: None of the answers apply

answers: The Sprint Backlog includes All answers apply, since are a decomposition of the selected Product Backlog items
explanation: User Stories, Use Cases, Tests, Tasks and even other elements which help to define and clarify the work can be part of the Sprint Backlog.

question: True or False. When multiple teams are working on the same product, one person can be a Developer of more than one Scrum Team.
answers: Yes
explanation: None of the Scrum accountabilities are necessarily full-time, and a single person can occupy more than one accountability or the same one in more than one team e.g., there may be a special expertise that is needed in multiple teams, but it's not needed on a full-time basis. So, one person can provide that special type of expertise to multiple teams. However, it's not recommended to have a person switching between projects, it's not productive.

question: True or not. The Product Owner decides how many Product Backlog items should be selected for the next Sprint.

options.A: Correct, based on the agreements with the customer
options.C: Incorrect, the PMO decides that
options.D: Incorrect, the Scrum master decides that
options.E: Correct

answers: No
explanation: The Product Owner sets the objective that the Sprint should achieve although can be influenced by the Developers. However, only Developers create the Increment, that’s why only they pull the Product Backlog items in order to accomplish Sprint Goal.

question: True or False. It is required to use Acceptance Criteria in the Product Backlog items.
answers: No
explanation: It's a good idea to use Acceptance Criteria to capture the requirements, but it's not mandatory.

question: Who must express clearly the Product Backlog items?

options.C: The Scrum Master
options.D: The Developers

answers: The Product Owner
explanation: The Product Owner owns the Product Backlog and is the sole person responsible for it. The Product Owner does Product Backlog management, like ensuring that the Product Backlog is transparent, visible and understood.

question: True or False. When we have more risk we need longer Sprints.
answers: No
explanation: When we have shorter Sprints, there are more opportunities to show progress, and receive feedback, validate our knowledge and therefore Adapt. The longer the Sprint, the higher the risk.

question: What’s the main responsibility of the Project Manager?

options.B: Help the team to implement good practices
options.C: There’s no Project Manager accountability in Scrum
options.D: Constantly verify the programmers’ results

answers: There’s no Project Manager accountability in Scrum
explanation: In Scrum we have only three accounts: the Product Owner, the Scrum Master and the Developers. It’s not permitted to define new accountabilities.

question: True or False. Every Increment should be released.
answers: No
explanation: Every Increment should be potentially releasable and completed based on the Definition of Done. However, Increment doesn’t have to be actually released. The Product Owner decides if it makes sense to release or not.

question: What's the normal timeboxed duration of Sprint Planning when there are 6 Developers in the team and Sprints are two weeks long?

options.C: 3 hours
options.D: 12 hours

answers: 4 hours
explanation: The timeboxed duration for Sprint Planning is 8 hours in a one-month Sprint, and normally shorter for shorter Sprints. If you have a shorter Sprint, it's not mandatory to shorten the timeboxed durations proportionally, but it's the normal thing to do. The key is the word "normal", we expect it to be shorter. if it was a "must" it would be 8 hours. Note that the duration of events is not dependent on the number of Developers.

question: What is the right criteria to order the Product Backlog?

options.B: Safer items are at the top, and riskier items are at the bottom
options.C: Whatever is deemed most appropriate by the Product Owner
options.D: The customer always decides

answers: Whatever is deemed most appropriate by the Product Owner
explanation: The decision on the order of items can be influenced by a committee, the customer, or any other stakeholder, but only the Product Owner decides what makes the most sense to optimize the value of the work being done by the Developers. The PO has the final word.

question: Which of the following are the results of the Sprint Planning? (Select the best two answers)

options.C: Complete Sprint Acceptance Criteria
options.D: Complete Sprint Documentation

answers: Sprint Backlog and Sprint Goal
explanation: The Sprint Goal and Sprint Backlog are created during the Sprint Planning meeting. The rest could change as more is learnt.

question: True or False. The Developers should prepare a complete infrastructure and set of tools for the project during the first Sprint.
answers: No
explanation: The Developers neither analyze, design nor describe the complete architecture and infrastructure, beforehand for the whole project. Agile processes are characterized by frequent short bursts of design, just enough to reach the Sprint Goal.

question: What is the Scrum accountability who knows the most about the project performance?

options.C: The Product Manager
options.D: The Developers
options.E: The Scrum Team

answers: The Product Owner
explanation: The Product Owner is responsible for measuring project performance. The Developers only measure the performance of the current Sprint.

question: True or False. The Scrum Master should not allow the Sprint Planning meeting to start when the Sprint Goal is not ready.
answers: No
explanation: The Sprint Goal is prepared during the Sprint Planning meeting. Also, Scrum Masters don't order people, they teach and convince people to do the right thing.

question: True or False. Only Product Backlog items that have been refined enough can be selected for the Sprint Backlog.
answers: No
explanation: If they are not Refined enough, the Developers should go with the best guess. Items that are not ready will be refined during the Sprint.

question: Which of the following can be reasons for the Scrum Master to attend the Daily Scrum?

options.A: To tell Developers what to do
options.B: It’s not necessary for the Scrum Master to be in the meeting
options.C: The Developers have asked the Scrum Master to facilitate their Daily Scrum
options.D: To participate as a Scrum Team member
options.E: To get a report on progress of the Sprint

answers: It’s not necessary for the Scrum Master to be in the meeting and The Developers have asked the Scrum Master to facilitate their Daily Scrum
explanation: The Scrum Master facilitates the meetings as requested or required. Daily Scrum is not for the Scrum Team, it's for the Developers (however anyone can join as a listener).

question: Which of the following statements best describe the purpose of having a Definition of Done? (Select the best three answers)

options.A: As the Developers are doing the work, they provide guidance on the remaining work needed to create the potentially shippable Increment by the end of the Sprint
options.B: It helps the Scrum Team decide how much time is needed before the Sprint can end
options.C: It creates transparency and provides a common understanding of the ‘done’ state of the Increment at the Sprint Review
options.D: It helps the Developers defer any pending work to subsequent Sprints
options.E: It provides guidance to the Developers when they are forecasting their Sprint Backlog during the Sprint Planning
options.F: It is a checklist to monitor the Developers’ progress on a task

answers: As the Developers are doing the work, they provide guidance on the remaining work needed to create the potentially shippable Increment by the end of the Sprint and It creates transparency and provides a common understanding of the ‘done’ state of the Increment at the Sprint Review and It provides guidance to the Developers when they are forecasting their Sprint Backlog during the Sprint Planning
explanation: When a Product Backlog item or an Increment is described as Done, everyone must understand what Done means. Scrum Team members must have a shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete, to ensure transparency and is used to assess when work is complete on the product Increment. This Definition of Done provides the team guidance on what it takes to make the Increment shippable.

question: Who can remove and replace Sprint Backlog items during the Sprint?

options.B: The Developers and the Product Owner
options.C: The Developers
options.D: The Scrum Master
options.E: The Scrum Team

answers: The Developers
explanation: Only the Developers can modify the Sprint Backlog throughout the Sprint, can’t modify the Sprint objective though. If there is time and the Developers have completed all the items, the team will pull the next item from the top of the Product Backlog.

question: What should the Scrum Team do during the Hardening Sprint?

options.B: There is no such thing as a Hardening Sprint
options.C: Code refactoring
options.D: Release the Increment
options.E: Work on technical debt

answers: There is no such thing as a Hardening Sprint
explanation: There’s no such thing as a Sprint Hardening Sprint. If the stories are correctly prioritized, the Definition of Done is unambiguous, and the Product Backlog is regularly refined based on business priorities, the teams should be able to complete the development tasks.

question: Which statements are not correct about Daily Scrums?

options.A: Developers must answer the 3 standard questions during the meeting
options.C: Only the Developers participate in the meeting
options.D: It’s always a 15-minute time boxed event, no matter how many Developers there are, or how long the Sprint is
options.E: It’s held at the same time and place every day

answers: Developers must answer the 3 standard questions during the meeting
explanation: It's common to go through the three standard questions, but it's not mandatory. It should be underlined that only the Developers articipate (talk). However others can join as listeners.

question: A programmer is not working properly and is blocking the progress of the team and their activities constantly. Who should decide about the future of this person as a member of the team?

options.C: The Developers
options.D: The Scrum Master

answers: The Developers
explanation: The Developers are self-managed, therefore this is a decision and responsibility of its members. Of course, the Scrum Master must address and support this decision since it is also an impediment.

question: Which of the following is the most productive way for the Scrum Master to improve the Developers' communications with the Product Owner?

options.A: Suggest effective communication tools and techniques to the Product Owner
options.B: Act as a go-between for them
options.C: Teach them how to effectively communicate
options.D: Monitor their communication performance

answers: Suggest effective communication tools and techniques to the Product Owner and Teach them how to effectively communicate and Monitor their communication performance
explanation: Acting as a go-between is not a sustainable solution. They should be self-managed. Make sure you have noticed the word "most" in the question.

question: Which of the following are not pillars of empirical process control?

options.C: Transparency, Eliminating Waste
options.D: Inspection, Transparency, Adaptation

answers: Respect for people, Eliminating Waste and Planning, Demonstration, Retrospective and Transparency, Eliminating Waste
explanation: According to Scrum Theory Scrum combines four formal events for inspection and adaptation within a containing event, the Sprint. These events work because they implement the empirical Scrum pillars of transparency, inspection, and adaptation.

question: True or False. Hardening Sprints are needed every few Sprints, to resolve dependencies and reduce technical debt.
answers: No
explanation: There’s no Hardening Sprint. There’s just one type of Sprint, and its goal is to create an Increment of potentially releasable valuable features.

question: True or False. Sprint Review is a formal meeting.
answers: No
explanation: it's a formal event but not a formal meeting, it is for the company internally not the customers. The Scrum Guide states the word formal in two different ways. First, all events are formal opportunities for inspecting and adapting, which basically means a serious opportunity. The second usage is formal meeting, which means a meeting where people approve something and exchange signatures. In that sense, none of the events are formal meetings. In the Sprint Review meeting, for example, the goal is creating feedback and adapting, not contract negotiations and exchanging signatures. The Scrum Guide states this detail: "Events are used in Scrum to create regularity and to minimize the need for meetings not defined in Scrum."

question: Who estimates the work during the Sprint?

options.C: The Scrum Team
options.D: The Developers and the Product Owner
options.E: No one

answers: The Developers
explanation: Developers do the work and they are the ones who best know what is needed to complete specific tasks, so they can only estimate them. Remember different teams might provide different estimates.

question: How much time should a Product Owner spend with the Developers?

options.C: As much as needed
options.D: All of their time

answers: As much as needed
explanation: Product Owners should be there when needed, it can be any amount of time.

question: True or False. Scrum Teams are allowed to use burn-up charts instead of burn-down charts.
answers: Yes
explanation: There are different things that can help them in this forecast, but they are all guesses and the Product Owner has to consider everything and adjust the forecast before presenting it to the stakeholders. It's very common to use burn-down charts in Agile, but it's up to the Product Owner to decide how they want to measure and visualize performance of the project, and up to the Developers to decide how they want to do it for Sprints.

question: Which accountability is the equivalent of Project Manager in Scrum?

options.C: Scrum Master
options.D: None of them
options.E: Team Leader

answers: None of them
explanation: There's no project manager accountability in Scrum, and it's not allowed to add new accountability to the existing three. Project management activities are distributed among all of them in the Scrum Team. This is only about the project level, you can always have higher management levels (e.g. program management), and those "can" be compatible with what you do in your Scrum projects. The Scrum Master is considered a role that manages people, but not a Project Manager.

question: Which two of the following are Scrum Master responsibilities?

options.B: Ensure the Product Owner attends all Scrum events
options.C: Assign tasks to the Developers
options.D: Causing the removal of impediments
options.E: Do monitoring and controlling for the progress of the Developers

answers: Leads Scrum adoption and Causing the removal of impediments
explanation: The Scrum Master serves the organization in several ways, including leading and coaching the organization in its Scrum adoption, planning Scrum implementations within the organization, also the Scrum Master serves the Developers in several ways, including, causing the removal of impediments to their progress.

question: What is the most effective way to sort the Product Backlog?

options.C: Complexity
options.D: Whatever the Developers decide
options.E: Risk

answers: Whatever the Product Owner decides
explanation: The Product Owner manages the Product Backlog, so it's up to her/him to decide the order. She/He should do it based on the value of the Items, remember the PO is also known as value maximizer.

question: Which of the following statements should be considered in setting the timeboxed duration of Sprints? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: It’s better to have shorter Sprints when the project is riskier
options.B: It should be shorter when there are more Developers
options.C: It should be longer in bigger projects
options.D: It shouldn’t be longer than one month
options.E: It shouldn’t be longer than 6 weeks

answers: It’s better to have shorter Sprints when the project is riskier and It shouldn’t be longer than one month
explanation: Shorter Sprints provide more adaptation opportunities, which reduces risks. The Scrum Guide states one month as the maximum.

question: True or False. During the Sprint Review, the Product Owner demonstrates the work that the Scrum Team has completed and answers questions about the Increment.
answers: No
explanation: As stated in the Scrum Guide: The purpose of the Sprint Review is to inspect the outcome of the Sprint and determine future adaptations. The Scrum Team presents the results of their work to key stakeholders and progress toward the Product Goal is discussed.

question: True or False. The Scrum Master should cancel the Sprint if the Product Owner has not created the Sprint Goal before Sprint Planning.
answers: No
explanation: The Scrum Team created the Sprint Goal during the Sprint Planning meeting, not the Product Owner. The Scrum Master can't cancel the Sprint.

question: When is the Sprint over? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: When the Scrum Master announces the end of the Sprint
options.B: When the Sprint Backlog tasks are done
options.C: When the Product Owner cancels the Sprint
options.D: When the timeboxed duration is over
options.E: When all Sprint Backlog items are done

answers: When the Product Owner cancels the Sprint and When the timeboxed duration is over
explanation: The timebox determines the length of the Sprint and the Product Owner is the only one who has the authority to cancel a Sprint.

question: Eva, the Product Owner, has been giving positive recognition to individual Developers who have moved their work to Done during the Daily Scrum. Eva wants to ensure the team is adhering to the ideal guideline on the burndown chart. What would be valid actions for Steven, the Scrum Master, to take? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: Steven coaches Eva on best practices for updating the burndown chart as it provides accurate information on how well the team is performing
options.B: Steven coaches the Scrum Team about the purpose of the Daily Scrum
options.C: Steven talks with Eva about concerns of how her behavior might impact the team members and requests that she stop attending for now
options.D: Nothing. Steven is optional at the Daily Scrum and it is the responsibility of the team to decide how to best run it

answers: Steven coaches the Scrum Team about the purpose of the Daily Scrum and Steven talks with Eva about concerns of how her behavior might impact the team members and requests that she stop attending for now
explanation: The Scrum Master is responsible for promoting and supporting Scrum as defined in the Scrum Guide. Scrum Masters do this by helping everyone understand Scrum Theory, practices, rules, and values. The Scrum Master serves the Scrum Team in several ways. The Scrum Master helps the Scrum Team understand which of their interactions are helpful and which aren’t. The Scrum Master helps everyone change these interactions to maximize the value created by the Scrum Team.

question: Which output of Sprint Planning provides an overall objective for the Sprint?

options.C: Sprint Goal
options.D: Release Plan
options.E: None of the answers apply

answers: Sprint Goal
explanation: The Scrum Team creates the Sprint Goal during the Sprint Planning meeting, it's a high-level objective for the Sprint.

question: True or False. If an organization is doing scaled Scrum they can have a committee to represent the Product Owner.
answers: No
explanation: The Product Owner is one person, not a committee. The Product Owner may represent the needs of many stakeholders in the Product Backlog. Those wanting to change the Product Backlog can do so by trying to convince the Product Owner.

question: True or False. Sprint Goal is not one of the inputs of a Sprint Planning meeting.
answers: Yes
explanation: The input of the Sprint Planning is the Product Backlog, the latest product Increment, projected capacity of the Developers during the Sprint, and past performance of the Developers(velocity). Make sure you have noticed the word "not" in the question.

question: Which of the following may not be done in the Sprint Retrospective meeting? (Select the best three answers)

options.A: Discuss the way Product Backlog refinement is done during the Sprints
options.B: Discuss the way Daily Scrum is done during the Sprint
options.C: Refining the Product Backlog
options.D: Discuss the Product Backlog items for the next Sprint
options.E: Calculate Velocity

answers: Refining the Product Backlog and Discuss the Product Backlog items for the next Sprint and Calculate Velocity
explanation: In general, Sprint Retrospective is about the context, not the content. For example, we talk about the way Product Backlog is refined, but we won't refine the Product Backlog in the Sprint Retrospective meeting. Make sure you have noticed the "not" in the question.

question: Which of the following are reasons Scrum promotes self-managed teams? (Select the best two answers)

options.B: Because they improve their regulations compliance
options.C: Because they improve their commitment
options.D: Because they improve their predictability

answers: Because they improve their self-accountability and Because they improve their commitment
explanation: Being self-managed implies that the team follows its very own process, rather than receiving orders. When it’s so, the members of the team tend to commit themselves and increase their accountability, and creativity.

question: Hatzis is a Product Owner of a seven member Scrum Team and he believes that the current velocity will not be sustainable. What could be wrong?

options.B: Having only low value items remaining in the Product Backlog
options.C: The possibility of having major changes in the future
options.D: The possibility of adding more items to the Product Backlog

answers: High technical debt
explanation: When you have technical debt, you will run into problems in the future, which will slow down your velocity.

question: Which events are timeboxed according to the Scrum Guide?

options.C: Release Retrospective
options.D: Release Testing
options.E: The Sprint

answers: Daily Scrum and The Sprint and Sprint Review
explanation: The Scrum Guide states that all Scrum Events are timeboxed. The Sprint to 1 month or less, Sprint Planning to maximum 8 hours for a one-month Sprint, Daily Scrum to 15-minutes, Sprint Review to maximum 4 hours for a one-month Sprint, and the Sprint Retrospective to maximum 3 hours for a one-month Sprint.

question: Who ensures that attendees of the Sprint Planning are prepared to discuss the most important Product Backlog items?

options.C: The Scrum Team
options.D: The Developers

answers: The Product Owner
explanation: As stated in the Scrum Guide "The Product Owner ensures that attendees are prepared to discuss the most important Product Backlog items and how they map to the Product Goal. The Scrum Team may also invite other people to attend Sprint Planning to provide advice."

question: Which of the following statements can be used to reduce technical debt? (Select the best two answers)

options.C: Refactoring the code
options.D: Improve the Definition of Done

answers: Refactoring the code and Improve the Definition of Done
explanation: Refactoring can improve the code without changing its external behavior. The better the Definition of Done the less the technical debt

question: Which of the following statements are correct about an item that is in-progress at the end of the Sprint? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: Move it back to the Product Backlog
options.B: Do not include it in the Increment
options.C: If the Product Owner is happy with it it can be part of the Increment
options.D: The Sprint will be extended until we complete the item
options.E: It can be added to the Increment if the user acceptance tests are done

answers: Move it back to the Product Backlog and Do not include it in the Increment
explanation: It should only be presented as the Increment in the Sprint Review. The Increment should meet the Definition of Done. If an item is not done, we won't include it in the Increment and send it back to the Product Backlog for the Product Owner to decide. Sprints are timeboxed, meaning that we don't extend their duration.

question: Which of the following are typical things that a Product Owner does between Sprint Planning and Sprint Review? (Select the best three answers)

options.C: Collaborate with stakeholders
options.D: Measure the Sprint performance
options.E: Answer questions from the Developers about items

answers: Product Backlog Refinement and Collaborate with stakeholders and Answer questions from the Developers about items
explanation: Product Backlog Refinement happens continuously. Regarding the Product Backlog items in the Sprint Backlog. If you have doubts, as a Developer, you always ask the Product Owner what is expected from the item. Collaboration with stakeholders is the key to make sure the Product Backlog is aligned and valuable.

question: The timebox of this Scrum Event should be no more than 15 minutes for one week Sprints.

options.C: Sprint
options.D: Sprint Retrospective
options.E: Daily Scrum

answers: Daily Scrum
explanation: The Daily Scrum is a 15-minute event for the Developers of the Scrum Team. To reduce complexity, it is held at the same time and place every working day of the Sprint.

question: True or False. Velocity is one of the inputs of a Sprint Planning meeting.
answers: Yes
explanation: The input of the Sprint Planning is the Product Backlog, the latest product Increment, projected capacity of the Developers during the Sprint, and past performance of the Developers(velocity).

question: Stuart is a Scrum Master of a team with 7 Developers. The Developers have realized that they have over committed themselves for the Sprint. What's the best for the Developers to do? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: They can make any adjustments themselves, because they own the Sprint Backlog
options.B: They can review and adjust the technical work of the items themselves
options.C: They shouldn’t make any changes to the Sprint Backlog
options.D: They can get help from the Product Owner to adjust the Sprint Backlog
options.E: They should ask the Product Owner to cancel the Sprint

answers: They can review and adjust the technical work of the items themselves and They can get help from the Product Owner to adjust the Sprint Backlog
explanation: They can't cancel the Sprint, only the Product Owner can do that. They are not allowed to adjust everything by themselves, they need to talk to the Product Owner for the functional tasks. If it is a technical task, then yes they can do it by themselves, as they know more, but that shouldn't impact functional requirements.

question: True or False. An increment can only be released after the Sprint Review.
answers: No
explanation: Multiple Increments may be created within a Sprint. The sum of the Increments is presented at the Sprint Review thus supporting empiricism. However, an Increment may be delivered to stakeholders prior to the end of the Sprint. The Sprint Review should never be considered a gate to releasing value.

question: What is right about the Product Goal? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: The Product Owner is also accountable for developing and explicitly communicating the Product Goal
options.B: The Developers should focus on their Sprint Backlog and not the Product Goal
options.C: The Scrum Master serves the Product Owner in finding techniques for effective Product Goal definition
options.D: The Scrum Team has the right to determine the Product Goal

answers: The Product Owner is also accountable for developing and explicitly communicating the Product Goal and The Scrum Master serves the Product Owner in finding techniques for effective Product Goal definition
explanation: As stated in the Scrum Guide the Product Owner is also accountable for developing and explicitly communicating the Product Goal. and the Scrum Master serves the Product Owner in finding techniques for effective Product Goal definition. Sprint Backlog should be built in a way towards the Product Goal.

question: True or False. It is Developers' responsibility to create valuable increments.
answers: No
explanation: The entire Scrum Team is accountable for creating a valuable, useful Increment every Sprint.

question: How much time do we need between a Sprint Retrospective and the next Sprint Planning to prepare the Product Backlog?

options.A: As much as the Product Owner finds necessary
options.C: As much as the Scrum Team finds necessary to complete Product Backlog refinement
options.D: As much as needed

answers: None
explanation: Each Sprint starts immediately after the previous one; there's nothing between the two.

question: True or False. Scrum Master can participate in Daily Scrum.
answers: No
explanation: Daily Scrum is for Developers they should only participate, others can join as listeners.

question: True or False. Only the Developers are allowed to attend the Sprint Retrospective.
answers: No
explanation: The Scrum Team is allowed to attend the Sprint Retrospective. This includes the Scrum Master and the Product Owner.

question: Which of the following is a benefit of self-managing?

options.C: Increased cross-functionality
options.D: Increased buy-in

answers: Increased buy-in
explanation: Self-management means that they make decisions instead of receiving orders passively. When people are self-managed, meaning that they make their own decisions instead of receiving orders, they take the decision-making process more seriously and will be more committed to the decision, which means creativity and dedication.

question: True or False. Only the Developers are allowed to determine the Definition of Done.
answers: No
explanation: The Scrum Team should be responsible for defining and adjusting the Definition of Done.

question: Which of the following statements best describes the Scrum Pillar of Transparency.

options.B: The emergent process and work must be visible to those performing the work as well as those receiving the work
options.C: The Scrum artifacts and the progress toward agreed goals must be inspected frequently and diligently to detect potentially undesirable variances or problems
options.D: If any aspects of a process deviate outside acceptable limits or if the resulting product is unacceptable, the process being applied or the materials being produced must be adjusted

answers: The emergent process and work must be visible to those performing the work as well as those receiving the work
explanation: As stated in the Scrum Guide: "The emergent process and work must be visible to those performing the work as well as those receiving the work. With Scrum, important decisions are based on the perceived state of its three formal artifacts. Artifacts that have low transparency can lead to decisions that diminish value and increase risk."

question: True or False. A Scrum Team is allowed to have two Scrum Masters if it is too large.
answers: No
explanation: The fundamental unit of Scrum is a small team of people, a Scrum Team. The Scrum Team consists of one Scrum Master, one Product Owner, and Developers.

question: Which of the following roles is the equivalent of Project Manager in Scrum?

options.C: Scrum Master
options.D: Team Leader
options.E: Developers

answers: None
explanation: There is no PM role in Scrum, it's only Scrum Master, Product Owner and Developers.

question: It's generally better to have shorter Sprints when the project is riskier.
answers: Yes
explanation: Shorter Sprints provide more opportunities for adaptation and thus reduce risks.

question: Which statement is true when Developers are in the middle of a Sprint?

options.A: The Sprint Backlog would be frozen
options.B: The scope may be clarified as more is learned
options.C: The scope will stay fixed until the end of the Sprint

answers: The scope may be clarified as more is learned
explanation: Spring Backlog has Sprint Goal, Product Backlog Items that can also be splitted as part of the refinement. The longer we work on these items, the more we learn about them.

question: Which of the following can be a reason for expecting lower velocity in the future?

options.A: Having only low-value items remaining in the Product Backlog
options.B: The possibility of having more items added to the Product Backlog
options.C: The possibility of having extreme changes in the future
options.D: High technical debt

answers: High technical debt
explanation: When you have technical debt, you will run into problems in the future, which will slow down your rate of development.

question: How would you know whether a Scrum Team is cross-functional?

options.A: They can do Test Driven Development if they decide to
options.B: They can do Pair-Programming if they decide to
options.C: Each Developer is expert in all technical layers of the system
options.D: They can create releasable Increments each Sprint

answers: They can create releasable Increments each Sprint
explanation: Cross-functional Developers must have all skills needed to create a releasable Increments every Sprint. A cross-functional Scrum Team is one that has all types of expertise that is required to develop the product. Note that the whole Scrum Team should be cross-functional, not individual team members. e.g. in this scenario here we could assume that Product Owner and Scrum Master are Developers as well.

question: Select two purposes of having a Definition of Done.

options.A: Helps to know what Backlog items should be pulled for the Sprint
options.B: Is another name for Definition of Ready
options.C: Helps the Scrum Master to measure the productivity of the Developers
options.D: Helps to create a shared understanding of what is the Backlog items scope in order to know when this is completed
options.E: Ensure transparency

answers: Helps to create a shared understanding of what is the Backlog items scope in order to know when this is completed and Ensure transparency
explanation: Everyone in the Scrum Team must understand what Definition of Done means. Although this may vary significantly per Scrum Team, members must have a shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete, to ensure transparency. It is used to assess when work is complete on the product Increment.

question: Which of the following statements relate technical debt with velocity? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: They are not related because technical debt should be resolved by the DevOps team
options.B: Velocity may unexpectedly drop when Developers run into
options.C: technical debt while attempting to complete new Product Backlog items
options.D: A Development Team can artificially increase its velocity by incurring technical debt
options.E: Adding new items for technical debt to the Product Backlog can guarantee predictability

answers: Velocity may unexpectedly drop when Developers run into and technical debt while attempting to complete new Product Backlog items
explanation: When you have technical debt, you will run into problems in the future, which will slow down your velocity.

question: How does the Developers determine the number of items for the Sprint Backlog?

options.B: Based on what the Scrum Master and the Product Owner agree
options.C: Based on velocity
options.D: Based on a combination of velocity and team capacity
options.E: In a way that maximizes the value of the Increment
options.F: Based on the Product Owner’s preferences

answers: Based on velocity and Based on a combination of velocity and team capacity and In a way that maximizes the value of the Increment
explanation: It's only up to the self-managing Developers to decide how many items they will select for the Sprint Backlog. The Sprint Backlog is a plan by and for the Developers. It is a highly visible, real-time picture of the work that the Developers plan to accomplish during the Sprint in order to achieve the Sprint Goal.

question: Which of the following statements can be used by the Product Owner to understand the progress of the Sprint? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: Ask the Scrum Master for daily briefs
options.C: Check the Sprint Backlog
options.D: Ask the team leader for daily briefs

answers: Attend the Daily Scrum and Check the Sprint Backlog
explanation: The Product Owner can attend as a listener the Daily Scrum to understand the progress. Sprint Backlog should also reflect Developers' progress.

question: True or False. It is mandatory to use burndown charts in Scrum.
answers: No
explanation: It is not mandatory to use it, however many Scrum Teams do it.

question: Who is expected to be involved in a Product Backlog refinement?

options.C: Product Owner and Developers

answers: Product Owner and Developers
explanation: The Product Owner because she/he knows more about the Product Backlog items and the Developers because they will work on those.

question: When is user acceptance testing done?

options.C: During the Sprint Review meeting
options.D: During the Sprint

answers: During the Sprint
explanation: Everything should happen within the Sprint, there are no Hardening Sprints or special events, as releases.

question: Which of the following are inputs to the Sprint Planning meeting?

options.C: Product Backlog items

answers: Previous Increment and Product Backlog items
explanation: The input of the Sprint Planning is the Product Backlog, the latest product Increment, projected capacity of the Developers during the Sprint, and past performance of the Developers(velocity). Sprint Goal is output.

question: Who is responsible for making sure that the Developers' work is built according to the Definition of Done?

options.C: The Developers
options.D: The Team Leader
options.E: The Scrum Master

answers: The Developers
explanation: Developers should deliver an Increment of product functionality according to the Definition of Done.

question: There is a project in an organization that is supposed to have two releases. The first one in the middle of the project and the second one at the end of the project. Which of the following statements are correct about this project?

options.A: All the Increments that are created before each release should be releasable
options.B: Increments are created for investigation and adaptation, they don’t have to be releasable
options.C: Having releasable Increments depends on the preference of the DevOps
options.D: All increments should be releasable

answers: All increments should be releasable
explanation: All Increments must be potentially releasable to enable usable feedback, regardless of the actual releases we may have.

question: Which of the following statements explain how Scrum promotes self-management? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: By being a simple and lightweight framework
options.C: By preventing stakeholders from contacting the Developers during the Sprint
options.D: By allowing the Developers to decide what to do during the Sprint

answers: By being a simple and lightweight framework and By allowing the Developers to decide what to do during the Sprint
explanation: Scrum is a lightweight framework that helps people, teams and organizations generate value through adaptive solutions for complex problems. Developers are self-managed so they can decide what to do during the Sprint.

question: The Developers of a Scrum Team decided to skip the Sprint Review for a couple of Sprints. Who is responsible for making sure that the meeting happens every Sprint?

options.C: The Development Manager
options.D: The Product Owner
options.E: The Stakeholders

answers: The Scrum Master
explanation: The Scrum Master is responsible for making sure that Scrum is properly applied in the organization. The Scrum Master should make sure that all events take place.

question: Which of the following statements are correct about the Scrum Team members? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: They are accountable for ordering the Product Backlog items
options.B: They set the timeboxed duration of Sprints
options.C: They measure the progress of the project
options.D: They compose the Sprint Goal
options.E: They decide about engineering and development methods

answers: They set the timeboxed duration of Sprints and They compose the Sprint Goal
explanation: The Product Owner orders the Product Backlog items. Sprint Goal and Sprint duration is something that the team decides. Developers are responsible for the technical decisions and the Product Owner for the progress of the project.

question: True or False. The UI designer is on holidays, so the Developers decided to build a mockup by themselves. This is part of the self-managing team, so they are allowed to do this.
answers: Yes
explanation: Developers should be able to manage their own work and remove any impediments if they can.

question: True or False. Scrum is a methodology which describes detailed steps to get working and releasable software.
answers: No
explanation: Scrum doesn’t describe any detailed step, and rather than a methodology is a framework.

question: True or False. The higher the velocity of a Scrum Team. the higher the value delivered.
answers: No
explanation: There's no direct relationship between velocity and value. Different teams have different velocities as well, so we can't compare them. If a Scrum Team works faster on less valuable items, velocity will be higher, but value may be the same, higher, or lower.

question: True or False. Eventually, the Scrum Master becomes unnecessary when the Developers mature through the project.
answers: No
explanation: If a project does not include Scrum Master or Product Owner accountabilities, this project is not doing Scrum. Both accountabilities can be part-time but always are performed in a Scrum project. One of the most important Scrum Master activities is causing the removal of impediments, and it doesn’t matter how mature the Developers are, its members will always benefit when someone takes care of these issues.

question: The Developers have difficulty understanding some of the requirements of the items in the Sprint Backlog. What would you do as a Product Owner?

options.A: Ask the Scrum Master to facilitate the communication between you and the Developers
options.B: Attend the Daily Scrums and answer their questions
options.C: Attend the Daily Scrums and remove their impediments
options.D: Spend as much time with them as needed, explaining the items and answering questions

answers: Spend as much time with them as needed, explaining the items and answering questions
explanation: Attending the Daily Scrum is only for the Developers, not for the Product Owner, it's not the wrong way to approach this but spending time with the Developers is the most appropriate way. The Scrum Master is not needed in this case as there is no conflict between them, it's just a matter of answering some questions, not facilitating the communication between them.

question: What are the best ways to address performance concerns? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: Have special Sprints that ensure those concerns
options.B: Dedicate a certain portion of the team capacity to working on those concerns
options.C: Add them to the Product Backlog
options.D: Add them to the Definition of Done

answers: Add them to the Product Backlog and Add them to the Definition of Done
explanation: If it's something that applies to many items and determines the way functional features work, it would be great to add them in the DoD. If it's about the performance of an existing function, adding them in the Product Backlog is reasonable, so you don't allow technical debt to grow. There are no "special" Sprints such as hardening Sprints or integration Sprints.

question: A Scrum Team has delivered 80 story points in the fourth Sprint and 90 story points in the sixth Sprint. Which one has delivered more value?

options.C: It depends
options.D: Sixth Sprint

answers: It depends
explanation: There's no direct relationship between velocity and value. Different teams have different velocities as well, so we can't compare them.

question: Who owns the Sprint Backlog?

options.C: The Product Owner
options.D: The Scrum Master
options.E: The Developers

answers: The Developers
explanation: The Sprint Backlog is a plan by and for the Developers. It is a highly visible, real-time picture of the work that the Developers plan to accomplish during the Sprint in order to achieve the Sprint Goal.

question: True or False. Scrum can be used for sustaining complex products.
answers: Yes
explanation: Scrum is a lightweight framework, not a methodology, process, techniques, etc. that helps people, teams and organizations generate value through adaptive solutions for complex problems.

question: True or False. Once the Sprint started, Developers can't add new items to the Sprint Backlog.
answers: No
explanation: Only the Developers can change the Sprint Backlog during a Sprint as they learn more or they might add non-functional requirements.

question: True or False. A Product Owner should have a complete Product Backlog before the first Sprint can start.
answers: No
explanation: Product Backlog is never complete, it evolves to reflect continuous changes.

question: Which one of the following is wrong about the Scrum Master accountability?

options.A: They make sure that the Developers have Daily Scrums
options.B: They facilitate the meetings as required or requested
options.C: They participate in Daily Scrums
options.D: None of the answers apply
options.E: They participate in the Sprint Planning meetings

answers: They participate in Daily Scrums
explanation: Daily Scrum is for Developers they should only participate, others can join as listeners. Note that the person who's doing the Scrum Master role may also do the role of a Developer, in which case, that person would participate in the Daily Scrum Meeting as a Developer.

question: What does it mean to say that an event has a timebox?

options.A: The event must happen by a given time
options.C: The event can take no more than a maximum amount of time
options.D: The event must take at least a minimum amount of time
options.E: The event must happen at a set time

answers: The event can take no more than a maximum amount of time
explanation: Timeboxed events are events that have a maximum duration.

question: True or False. Scrum is a process for developing complex products.
answers: No
explanation: Scrum is "considered" a framework, not a methodology, process, techniques, etc. It can be used to develop new products or maintain/sustain existing ones.

question: What's the recommended way to estimate items, if you want to apply Scrum properly.

options.C: Both of the above
options.D: None of the above

answers: None of the above
explanation: There is no recommended way for estimates in the Scrum Guide. They are free to use whatever is the best for them.

question: True or False. When multiple Scrum Teams are working on the same product and each one on different areas of the product, they should have a different Product Goal.
answers: No
explanation: The Product Goal describes a future state of the product which can serve as a target for the Scrum Team to plan against. The Product Goal is in the Product Backlog. The rest of the Product Backlog emerges to define “what” will fulfill the Product Goal, this is about the whole product.

question: Which of the following statements describe benefits of having a Product Goal? (Select the best two answers)

options.A: It helps identify the best time for releasing the product
options.B: It makes it easier to inspect the incremental progress of the product
options.C: It gives an overall objective to all Sprints
options.D: It helps identify when the complete Product Backlog should be finished
options.E: It’s a traditional concept, and there are no benefits to having it

answers: It makes it easier to inspect the incremental progress of the product and It gives an overall objective to all Sprints
explanation: The Product Goal describes a future state of the product which can serve as a target for the Scrum Team to plan against. The Product Goal is in the Product Backlog. The rest of the Product Backlog emerges to define “what” will fulfill the Product Goal.

question: Which artifact contains a plan for making visible the Product Goal?

options.C: Increment

answers: Product Backlog
explanation: The Product Backlog is composed of the Product Goal. Product Goal is commitment. The Product Goal describes a future state of the product.
